newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan consumers to pay CFC recovery cost -- paper.
newsitem.headline: Japan consumers to pay CFC recovery cost -- paper.

text.p: The Ministry of International Trade and Industry and car industry bodies plan to require car owners to pay about 3,000 yen to recover chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) from air conditioners when cars are scrapped, the Japanese business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun said on Wednesday.
The plan will be implemented by the end of the year, the paper said.
It said the ministry would also make consumers foot the bill for recovering CFCs from appliances such as refrigerators and air conditioners in the future.
The ministry and car industry associations were not immediately available for comment on the report.
